TaskDescription: Searching for a hotspot in the motor or visual cortex of the brain

TmsStimulator.ManufacturersModelName: MagProX100 MAGOPTION or MagProR30 MAGOPTION or NexStim

Levels.cobot: Coil is controlled by a cobot system
Levels.robot: Coil is controlled by a robotic system

StimulusMode.Description: Type of stimulus(e.g. single, twin, burst, etc). Depends on Stimulator options.

CurrentDirection.Description: Direction of induced current (e.g. normal, reverse).

Waveform.Description: Shape of the TMS pulse (e.g. monophasic, biphasic, etc).

ProtocolName.Description: (when using sequence stimulation) The sequence timing mode unique name. (e.g. sici,lici,custom, etc)

InterDoublePulseInterval.Description: IDPI - The duration between the beginning of the first pulse to the beginning of the second pulse in twin or dual stimulation mode

InterPulseInterval.Description: IPI - The duration between the beginning of the first pulse to the beginning of the second pulse (Interval between pulses in train in sequence mode).

BurstPulsesNumber.Description: Number of pulses in a burst

PulseRate.Description: (Optional) the number of pulses per second (pps or Hz)

TrainPulses.Description: The number of pulses in each train.

RepetitionRate.Description: The repetition rate refers to the number of repetitions per second (pps) at which the pulses are generated. Hz equivalent

InterRepetitionInterval.Description: The duration between the beginning of the first burst to the beginning of the second burst. T=1/f (msec)

TrainDuration.Description: The duration of the train stimulation

TrainNumber.Description: The number of trains in sequence

InterTrainInterval.Description: The time interval between two trains is described as the time period between the last pulse in the first train to the first pulse in the next train.

InterTrainIntervalDelay.Description: Additional individual time delay that can be added to the InterTrainInterval for each Train in custom protocols

TrainRampUp.Description: The Ramp Up function allows programming a gradual increase in amplitude with each train during burst stimulation.

TrainRampUpNumber.Description: The number of trains applied for Ramp Up function

MarkerID.Description: Unique identifier of stimulation target point. Follow the _markers.tsv

PeelingDepth.Description: Depth “distance” from cortex surface to the target point OR from the entry marker to the target marker.

StimStepCount.Description: Count of pulses determines the stepping and number of pulses produced per mark.

PulseAmplitude.Description: An expression for the power output level as a percentage of maximum stimulator power

DoublePulseAmplitude.Description: Actual for Dual_mode. The independent amplitude of the second pulse as a percentage of maximum stimulator power.

PulseAmplitudeRatio.Description: Actual for Twin_mode. Ratio of the amplitude of two pulses B/A.

PulseAmplitudeRMT.Description: Stimulation intensity as a percentage of the Resting Motor Threshold (% of RMT).

StimValidation.Description: Validation of the applied stimulation. Whether stimulation was validated (

CurrentGradient.Description: Actual measured value of the coil current gradient.

ElectricFieldTarget.Description: Electric field at the target point

ElectricFieldMax.Description: Peak electric field generated by the coil

ResponseChannelName.Description: Channel name used for the response (motor-response) measurement.

ResponseChannelType.Description: Type of channel used for response measurement. The channel types are similar to the list of eeg modality channel type.

Comments.Description: Additional comments about the stimulation process

Timestamp.Description: Timestamp of the stimulation event in ISO 8601 format
